text: Antheia or Anthea () was a town in the Troezene in ancient Argolis, said to have been founded by the mythological figure Anthes. In mythology, King Pittheus transferred the town's population (synoecism) to Troezen. The site is near modern Damala. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Argolis Category:Former populated places in Greece Category:Locations in Greek mythology
title: Antheia (Argolis)
